subject: Leadership
title: Conformity and Obedience
description: A quick, practical guide to Conformity and Obedience.

hook.text: In Asch's experiment, people chose obviously wrong answers just because others did. 75% conformed at least once.

buildup.text: Conformity is adjusting behavior to match the group. It's wired into our brains as a survival mechanism.

discovery.text: Milgram showed people would deliver dangerous shocks when an authority figure told them to. Obedience is powerful.

twist.text: Leaders underestimate their authority. A casual suggestion from the boss becomes an unquestioned order down the chain.

climax.text: Ask: 'Am I getting agreement or compliance?' Create space for dissent. True buy-in requires freedom to say no.

punchline.text: When everyone agrees, somebody isn't thinking.

quiz.question: What did Milgram's experiment reveal?
options: People obey authority even against their judgment
Authority always leads to good outcomes
